I would recommend "Maid in Manhattan" to you. It is a romantic comedy that follows the life of an aspiring Broadway actress who finds herself in the middle of a love triangle with a famous actor and a struggling actor. The movie is filled with witty dialogue, romantic scenes, and comedic moments that will keep you laughing throughout the entire movie.
The actors in this movie are also very talented. Bessie Love plays the role of an aspiring Broadway actress who finds herself in the middle, as I just said above. Michael Byrne plays the role of a famous actor who is struggling to make ends meet in life. And finally, Piper Perabo plays the role of a struggling actor who is trying to get on the right path in life.
So overall, "Maid in Manhattan" is a very entertaining romantic comedy movie that I would definitely recommend to you.

conversation.text: Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The Great Gatsby" by F. Scott Fitzgerald. This movie is a classic of American literature and cinema, set in the fictional town of New York in the 1920s. The movie stars Leonardo DiCaprio as Jay Gatsby, an extremely wealthy man who lives in the luxurious town of West Egg. Gatsby is known for his extravagant parties, which are often attended by beautiful women. However, it is revealed that all of Gatsby's lavish parties were actually funded by another wealthy man named Tom Buchanan (played by Robert De Niro). Despite this revelation, Gatsby continues to throw extravagant parties in an attempt to win back the love of his life, Daisy Buchanan (played by Kim Catlie)).
